intro: Begonia micranthera, commonly known as the small-flowered begonia, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces small, delicate flowers in shades of pink or white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and modest blooms. Begonia micranthera prefers partial shade and is relatively easy to care for in a humid environment.
